title: MCP Response Integrity
question: Why does the MCP bridge return unexpected/mismatched responses, and what architectural changes are needed to guarantee response integrity?
context: Despite fixes for BUG-064 (drain after timeout) and BUG-065 (request_lock serialization), MCP calls still return unexpected response types (PaneResized, SessionList, PaneContent instead of expected responses) and sometimes execute on wrong targets (kill_session killing different session than requested). This was observed in Session 18 when killing midwestmtg sessions.
constraints: Must not break existing working features
Prefer simple fixes over architectural rewrites
